column4: hi, does anybody know where to get usleep source code for ubuntu?
I need usleep but it's not in Gutsy
what, you mean a command line program called usleep?
i see... because i've tried to compile some but it gets error
i wonder if i need specific code for ubuntu
i just have the usleep.c files
i need the source code or maybe pre-compiled if exists
i couldn't find it, that's why i ask if you know
I've never heard of a usleep command... and, of course, the function call would be in glibc (and, probably, the kernel sources).
i wanna use usleep in my bash script
but it's not here in gutsy
i found that usleep is suppose to be in /bin/usleep in other distro
but i cannot find any packages in ubuntu containing usleep
that's why i wonder if i can compile the source code
y'know, GNU sleep supports non-integral numbers of seconds...
